instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2565: What is 820-2565? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
I found burnt transistor or mosfet (3 pin chip) on dc jack on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2565</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dc jack board. 

I tested main board with another dc jack but same story. CPU core appear only for 1 seg at 1.12V
I compared all coils with another board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and only found differen value at L7260. In faulty board I have 0.173 in diode mode. Red in ground
In working board I have 0.400 in diode mode. Anything more I can measure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: Must be liquid damage, check around clock chip/SMC/ROM chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: I checked the board and it is not liquid damage. I reflowed with flux rom and clock chip but no change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: Try another known good BIOS. Keep the old one!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: Board for i5 and i7 have same bios, right? I mean 3115 is only what I have to look in donor board, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: Also without bios this board will loooping right? Now it is not looping. CPU core appear for a seg and fan speed for a seg. Nothing more.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: All 3115 BIOSes are the same and should work for testing. Watch out the China parts boards may have the BIOS chip erased!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: I replaced bios from another not china board and same. CPU-core for 0.5seg

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: Did you check if the chip has content? I warned you they erase them sometimes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: It is not china board. Comes from a macbook I didnot repair weeks ago with another problem. I was told 3115 board has PCH ussual problems, but I never tried to replace that. What do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message:
This could be anything if it is not liquid damage. The usual suspects when it was liquid damage is the clock chip or crap under SMC. I very much doubt this board "just" stopped working.
Put back the original BIOS to avoid ME region problems and replace the clock chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: I checked again the board and found bad looking <CAPACITOR>C4921</CAPACITOR>. I replaced with solder (no heat arround) and now works and power. Make sense <CAPACITOR>C4921</CAPACITOR> to stop the board from power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: No, just corrosion. Make it sense?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU core appear for 1 seg
threads.message: It is possible that AVREF was being pulled down. It is also possible that there is crap under the SMC
